_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Safety at Kroger is inherent in the manner in which anhydrous ammonia is handled. The design of the facility incorporates multiple safety devices, such as refrigeration controls, interlocks, alarms, and ammonia detection systems. Safe handling procedures, maintaining mechanical integrity, and appropriate training of our personnel are key elements of the Kroger safety program.
Kroger has implemented a process safety management (PSM) program that complies with 29 CFR 1910.119, which requires Kroger to develop safeguards to prevent an ammonia release. A component of the PSM plan is the emergency action plan, developed consistent with 29 CFR 1910.38. The emergency action plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordination with external responders.
Facility Description and Substances Handled
Kroger is a cold storage facility that stores and distributes produce. Cold storage requires the use of a refrigeration system to preserve the integrity of foods, and Kroger uses ammonia as the refrigerant. Access to the facility is limited to authorized employees, management personnel, and contractors.
General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
Kroger's written PSM plan incorporates many policies and procedures to ensure the safe operation and maintenance of refrigeration equipment. Plan elements include employee participation, process safety information, process hazard analysis (PHA), operating procedures, training, contractor safety, pre-startup safety review, mechanical integrity, management of change, hot-work permits, incident investigation, emergency response and planning, and compliance audits. This plan will be reviewed annually, audited every three years, and updated as necessary by Kroger.
Training is provided to ensure that each employee involved in operating the refrigeration system understands the refrigeration process, the operating procedures, and safety considera

tions. Only qualified maintenance personnel operate the refrigeration system.
Five-Year Accident History
There have been no reportable accidents at the Kroger facility in the past five years. 
Emergency Planning and Response
Kroger has a written emergency action plan to ensure that precautions and procedures are in place to protect employee and public health and safety during a chemical emergency. It complies with the provisions of 29 CFR 1910.38. The emergency action plan includes pre-emergency planning and coordinating with external responders. This enables those who deal with emergencies to have a course of action to effectively deal with unplanned events. This plan has been provided to and reviewed with the local fire department.
The approach in the development of this plan has been to identify the ammonia emergencies most likely to occur at Kroger and to establish precautions and procedures to protect life, safety, and health during an emergency. The refrigeration process has backup prevention systems to keep malfunctions from becoming ammonia-release emergencies. If an emergency does occur, Kroger has trained personnel to immediately notify the local fire department and take defensive actions to mitigate the release. Automatic alarms, shutdown systems, and controls have been designed to minimize the potential for an uncontrolled release.
All Kroger personnel are trained to fulfill their designated responsibilities in an emergency. Mock emergency drills are held periodically to maintain familiarity with response actions and identify plan elements requiring improvement.
This plan shall be reviewed annually and updated as necessary. 
Planned Changes to Improve Safety
Upgrades or extensive maintenance work performed in the future will comply with codes and standards applicable at that time. Kroger completed a process hazard analysis in April 2022. As a result, Kroger plans to address the recommendations such as updating written operating procedures, providing addi

tional guarding for ammonia equipment, and providing additional safeguards when using powered mobile equipment in the engine room. Kroger will address and track assigned target dates and the completion status of all PHA, compliance audit, and mechanical integrity recommendations to ensure items are addressed promptly.
